meaning: 나를 완전히 무시했어. (아는 척 안 함)
example:
A: I waved at you, but you cut me dead.
B: Seriously? I didn't see you.
A: You looked right at me.
B: I need new glasses.
A: Sure you do.
B: I swear!
japanese: 無視（むし）された。／シカトされた。
chinese: 我去健身房了 (Wǒ qù jiànshēnfáng le) / 去撸铁了 (Qù lū tiě le)

meaning: 뭐 묻은 개가 뭐 묻은 개 나무란다
similar: 3. Takes a thief to catch a thief
example:
A: You are being so incredibly lazy today.
B: Well, take ones to know one.
A: I’ve been cleaning the whole kitchen!
B: Talk about the pot calling the kettle black, you napped all day.
A: That was a well-deserved rest!
B: Whatever, you should look in the mirror before judging.
japanese: お前（まえ）が言（い）うな。／似（に）た者（もの）同士（どうし）だ。
chinese: 别客气 (Bié kèqi) / 常联系啊 (Cháng liánxì a)

example:
A: Did you know global warming will end us all?
B: Dude, don't kill the vibe. We're partying.
A: Just stating facts.
B: Save it for Monday.
A: Sorry.
B: Drink this.
japanese: 水（みず）を差（さ）さないで。／白（しら）けさせないで。
chinese: 别太累了 (Bié tài lèi le) / 慢慢来 (Mànman lái)

example:
A: Have you lost weight?
B: A little. I cut out sugar.
A: It shows.
B: Thanks! My jeans fit better.
A: Keep it up.
B: I miss donuts though.
japanese: 痩（や）せた？／スリムになった？
chinese: 我在减肥 (Wǒ zài jiǎnféi) / 我在控食 (Wǒ zài kòngshí)

example:
A: How's the pizza?
B: Ideally? It's too greasy.
A: Blot it with a napkin.
B: I'm just gonna eat the crust.
A: Health nut.
B: My arteries thank me.
japanese: 油（あぶら）っこすぎる。／ギトギトしてる。
chinese: 有什么圈套吗? (Yǒu shénme quāntào ma?) / 条件是什么? (Tiáojiàn shì shénme?)

similar: Like two peas in a pod.
example:
A: You and Sarah seem close.
B: Yeah, we bonded so quickly.
A: Shared interests?
B: Shared trauma, actually.
A: That's the strongest bond.
B: Tell me about it.
japanese: すぐに意気投合（いきとうごう）した。／すぐ仲良（なかよ）くなった。
chinese: 真有你的 (Zhēn yǒu nǐ de) / 奇葩 (Qípā)

similar: Taking a rain check on work.
example:
A: Are you at work?
B: No, I called in sick.
A: Are you okay?
B: Just a mental health day.
A: Good for you.
B: Netflix marathon time.
japanese: 病欠（びょうけつ）した。／ズル休（やす）みした。
chinese: 抱歉，我的错 (Bàoqiàn, wǒ de cuò) / 怪我怪我 (Guài wǒ guài wǒ)

example:
A: Want some cake?
B: Can't, I'm trying to cut back on sugar.
A: Just one bite?
B: You're the devil.
A: I know.
B: Okay, just a forkful.
japanese: 減（へ）らす。／節製（せっせい）する。
chinese: 已经准备好了 (Yǐjīng zhǔnbèi hǎo le) / 我这边完事了 (Wǒ zhèbiān wánshì le)

example:
A: This party is boring.
B: Let's sneak out of here.
A: The back door?
B: Lead the way.
A: Ninja mode.
B: Shh.
japanese: こっそり抜（ぬ）け出（だ）す。／ドロンする。
chinese: 萝卜青菜各有所爱 (Luóbo qīngcài gè yǒu suǒ ài) / 随个人便吧 (Suí gèrén biàn ba)

example:
A: Can you set me up with your friend?
B: Which one?
A: The tall writer.
B: He's weird.
A: I like weird.
B: Okay, but don't blame me.
japanese: 紹介（しょうかい）する。／くっつける。
chinese: 还行吧 (Hái xíng ba) / 挺好的 (Tǐng hǎo de)

example:
A: He's talking about crypto again.
B: Oh no, here we go again.
A: Prepare for a lecture.
B: I'm going to the bathroom.
A: Take me with you.
B: Run.
japanese: また始（はじ）まった。／これだよ。
chinese: 闲聊 (Xiánliáo) / 寒喧 (Hánxuān)

primary: I don't want to twist your arm
example:
A: I really shouldn't cancel my plans.
B: I don't want to twist your arm, but the concert will be epic.
A: Ugh, you're making this hard.
B: Just stating facts.
A: Fine, I'll go.
B: Yay!
japanese: 無理（むり）強いはしたくない。／強制（きょうせい）はしないよ。
chinese: 别灰心 (Bié huīxīn) / 挺胸抬头 (Tǐngxiōng táitóu)

example:
A: You really need to stop spending money on shoes.
B: That’s rich coming from you, Mr. New iPhone.
A: That was a necessary upgrade for work!
B: Look who's talking about "necessary" purchases.
A: I'm just saying we need a budget.
B: Talk about irony, you bought a luxury watch last week!
japanese: よく言（い）うよ。／お前（まえ）が言（い）うな。
chinese: 不可能 (Bù kěnéng) / 绝对不行 (Juéduì bùxíng)

example:
A: I decided to buy the first round.
B: Now we're talking!
A: Don't get used to it.
B: Too late.
A: Expensive taste.
B: Only the best.
japanese: そうこなくっちゃ！／待（ま）ってました！
chinese: 我也去 (Wǒ yě qù) / 算我一个 (Suàn wǒ yīgè)

primary: Don't count your chickens before they hatch
example:
A: I'm going to spend my bonus on a car.
B: You haven't got the bonus yet.
A: It's guaranteed.
B: Don't count your chickens before they hatch.
A: You're a buzzkill.
B: I'm a realist.
japanese: 取（と）らぬ狸（たぬき）の皮算用（かわざんよう）。／先走（さきばし）るな。
chinese: 我参加 (Wǒ cānjiā) / 算我一个 (Suàn wǒ yīgè)

meaning: 어때? 마음에 들어? (또는 정도를 물을 때: 스테이크 굽기 등)
example:
A: I cut my hair short.
B: How do you like it?
A: I love it, it's so light.
B: It looks great on you.
A: Thanks!
B: Very chic.
japanese: どう？／気（き）に入（い）った？
chinese: 别闹了 (Bié nào le) / 停下来 (Tíng xiàlái)

example:
A: Are you going to throw a party for your birthday?
B: Maybe just a small dinner.
A: Boring. Let's rage.
B: I'm too old for that.
A: Never too old.
B: My back disagrees.
japanese: パーティーを開（ひら）く。／パァーっとやる。
chinese: 为什么呀? (Wèishénme ya?) / 为了啥? (Wèile shá?)

primary: Don't read too much into it
example:
A: Why did he text me an emoji?
B: Don't read too much into it. It's just a smiley.
A: But implies interest!
B: It implies he has thumbs.
A: You're no help.
B: Just truth.
japanese: 深読（ふかよ）みしないで。／考（かんが）えすぎないで。
chinese: 没关系 (Méiguānxi) / 算了 (Suànle)

meaning: 물어본다고 손해 볼 건 없잖아. (밑져야 본전)
example:
A: Do you think they'll give me a discount?
B: Probably not.
A: It doesn't hurt to ask.
B: True. Go for it.
A: Excuse me!
B: Good luck.
japanese: 聞（き）くだけタダだよ。／言（い）ってみれば？
chinese: 目前一切顺利 (Mùqián yīqiè shùnlì) / 还可以 (Hái kěyǐ)

similar: It makes me laugh so hard.
example:
A: Have you seen this cat video?
B: Yes, it cracks me up every time.
A: The way it jumps!
B: Comedy gold.
A: Animals are the best.
B: Agreed.
japanese: 超（ちょう）ウケる。／爆笑（ばくしょう）した。
chinese: 时间过得真快 (Shíjiān guò de zhēn kuài) / 光阴似箭 (Guāngyīnsìjiàn)

example:
A: Want to go to a karaoke bar?
B: I'd rather not. My voice is terrible.
A: No one cares! It's fun.
B: I care. My ears care.
A: Party pooper.
B: Proudly.
japanese: 遠慮（えんりょ）しとく。／やめとく。
chinese: 你在开玩笑吧? (Nǐ zài kāiwánxiào ba?) / 真的假的? (Zhēnde jiǎde?)

example:
A: He won't eat anything green.
B: He's so picky.
A: It's annoying to cook for him.
B: Tell him to cook for himself.
A: Good idea.
B: Problem solved.
japanese: 選（よ）り好（ごの）みする。／うるさい。
chinese: 我也不知道 (Wǒ yě bù zhīdào) / 难倒我了 (Nándǎo wǒ le)

similar: You mean a lot to me.
example:
A: Why did you help me?
B: Because I care about you.
A: I didn't know.
B: Well, now you do.
A: Thanks.
B: Anytime.
japanese: 大事（だいじ）に思（おも）ってる。／大切（たいせつ）だ。
chinese: 我累死了 (Wǒ lèi sǐ le) / 精疲力竭 (Jīngpílìjié)

example:
A: I think I'm definitely getting that promotion.
B: Look, don’t get your hopes up just yet.
A: But the boss said I’m the best candidate.
B: Just keep your expectations in check, anything can happen.
A: You think it’s a long shot?
B: I'm just saying don't bank on it until you sign the contract.
japanese: 期待（きたい）しすぎないで。／ぬか喜（よろこ）びしないで。
chinese: 绝无可能 (Jué wú kěnéng) / 想都别想 (Xiǎng dōu bié xiǎng)

example:
A: How's the new puppy?
B: He's a handful. Chewed my shoes.
A: But so cute.
B: That's how they survive.
A: Patience.
B: Pray for my shoes.
japanese: 手（て）に負（お）えない。／世話（せわ）が焼（や）ける。
chinese: 坚持住 (Jiānchí zhù) / 挺住 (Tǐng zhù)

example:
A: Do you like my painting?
B: It's... how shall I put it? Unique.
A: That means you hate it.
B: It's very abstract.
A: Just say it's bad.
B: It's... interesting.
japanese: なんて言（い）えばいいかな。／言葉（ことば）を選（えら）ぶと。
chinese: 真为你高兴 (Zhēn wèi nǐ gāoxìng) / 不错嘛 (Bùcuò ma)

example:
A: You look sad.
B: I had to put my dog down yesterday.
A: I'm so sorry.
B: He was really sick.
A: He's in a better place.
B: I miss him.
japanese: 犬（いぬ）を安楽死（あんらくし）させる。／天国（てんごく）へ送（おく）る。
chinese: 我明白了 (Wǒ míngbai le) / 原来如此 (Yuánláirúcǐ)

example:
A: The manager is so nice to the VP.
B: But he screams at us.
A: Classic kiss up, kick down.
B: I hate people like that.
A: Karma will get him.
B: Hopefully soon.
japanese: 上（うえ）にはへつらい下（した）には厳（きび）しい。／強（きょう）きに弱（よわ）く弱（よわ）きに強（つよ）い。
chinese: 你决定吧 (Nǐ juédìng ba) / 听你的 (Tīng nǐ de)

example:
A: How's the boat?
B: It's a total white elephant. Repairs cost a fortune.
A: Sell it.
B: No one wants it.
A: Sink it?
B: Tempting.
japanese: 無用（むよう）の長物（ちょうぶつ）。／邪魔（じゃま）っけなもの。
chinese: 以防万一 (Yǐ fáng wàn yī) / 保险起见 (Bǎoxiǎn qǐjiàn)

primary: Crispy on the outside, tender on the inside
example:
A: This fried chicken is amazing.
B: It's crispy on the outside, tender on the inside.
A: Best I've ever had.
B: We need to order more.
A: Diet ruined.
B: Worth it.
japanese: 外（そと）はサクサク中（なか）はジューシー。／カリフワ。
chinese: 保持联系 (Bǎochí liánxì) / 常联系 (Cháng liánxì)

example:
A: Did you see that car?
B: Yeah, he came out of nowhere!
A: Almost hit us.
B: People need to drive better.
A: My heart is racing.
B: Deep breaths.
japanese: どこからともなく現（あらわ）れた。／突然（とつぜん）出（で）てきた。
chinese: 好久不见 (Hǎojiǔ bùjiàn) / 多年未见 (Duōnián wèi jiàn)

example:
A: I love your dress.
B: It's scarlet, my favorite color.
A: It stands out.
B: That's the point.
A: Very bold.
B: Go big or go home.
japanese: 深紅（しんく）。／真（ま）っ赤（か）。
chinese: 别客气 (Bié kèqi) / 当成自己家 (Dàngchéng zìjǐ jiā)

example:
A: I was away for a week.
B: A lot happened.
A: Catch me up.
B: Well, first of all, John was fired.
A: No way!
B: Way.
japanese: 事情（じじょう）を説明（せつめい）して。／話（はなし）聞（き）かせて。
chinese: 没问题 (Méi wèntí) / 没事儿 (Méishìr)

example:
A: Where's your phone?
B: I got mugged last night.
A: Are you hurt?
B: Just bruised, but they took everything.
A: Call the police.
B: Already did.
japanese: カツアゲされた。／強盗（ごうとう）に遭（あ）った。
chinese: 在路上 (Zài lùshàng) / 已经在过来了 (Yǐjīng zài guòlái le)

primary: Don’t get me wrong / hear me out
meaning: 오해하지 말고 내 말 좀 끝까지 들어봐
similar: 3. Don't take this the wrong way
4. Give me a chance to finish
example:
A: I think we should cancel the party. 
B: What? Everyone is already invited! 
A: Don't get me wrong, I want to celebrate too. 
B: Then why are you saying we should cancel? 
A: Hear me out, the weather report says a blizzard is coming. 
B: Oh, let me be clear, safety definitely comes first then.
japanese: 最後（さいご）まで聞（き）いて。／悪（わる）く取（と）らないで。
chinese: 回头见 (Huítóu jiàn) / 待会儿见 (Dài huìr jiàn)

example:
A: That performance was iconic.
B: She's a queen.
A: History in the making.
B: I'll never forget it.
A: Saved it to my phone.
B: Send it to me.
japanese: 象徴（しょうちょう）的（てき）。／レジェンド級（きゅう）。
chinese: 随你便 (Suí nǐ biàn) / 你看着办吧 (Nǐ kànzhe bàn ba)

example:
A: This room is freezing.
B: It's really drafty in here.
A: Close the window.
B: It is closed.
A: We need a heater.
B: Or a blanket.
japanese: 隙間風（すきまかぜ）が入（はい）る。／スースーする。
chinese: 保重 (Bǎozhòng) / 注意安全 (Zhùyì ānquán)

example:
A: My back hurts.
B: Go see a masseur.
A: Do you know a good one?
B: Try the place on Main St.
A: Expensive?
B: Worth every penny.
japanese: マッサージ師（し）。／整体（せいたい）師（し）。
chinese: 还是谢谢你 (Háishì xièxie nǐ) / 心领了 (Xīnlǐng le)

example:
A: The internet is down again.
B: It's so frustrating!
A: I can't work.
B: Let's go to a cafe.
A: Fine.
B: Their wifi is fast.
japanese: イライラする。／もどかしい。
chinese: 等一下 (Děng yīxià) / 等会儿 (Děng huìr)

example:
A: Want to have a big party?
B: Nah, I want to keep it low-key.
A: Just pizza and beer?
B: Exactly.
A: Sounds perfect.
B: No drama.
japanese: 地味（じみ）に。／控（ひか）えめに。
chinese: 怎么了? (Zěnme le?) / 最近怎么样? (Zuìjìn zěnmeyàng?)

example:
A: I'm wearing a neon suit.
B: Don't stand out too much.
A: Why?
B: We're sneaking in.
A: Oh, right.
B: Change into black.
japanese: 目立（めだ）たないようにして。／溶（と）け込（こ）んで。
chinese: 不客气 (Bù kèqi) / 别客气 (Bié kèqi)

example:
A: My room is my safe haven.
B: No parents allowed?
A: Exactly.
B: I need a lock on my door.
A: Get one.
B: I will.
japanese: 避難（ひなん）場所（ばしょ）。／聖域（せいいき）。
chinese: 总算 (Zǒngsuàn) / 终于到时候了 (Zhōngyú dào shíhòu le)

example:
A: I need five outfit changes for dinner.
B: Don't be so extra. It's just pizza.
A: I have a rep to maintain.
B: No one cares.
A: I care.
B: Clearly.
japanese: 調子（ちょうし）に乗（の）らないで。／やりすぎないで。
chinese: 准备好了 (Zhǔnbèi hǎo le) / 没问题了 (Méi wèntí le)

meaning: 진이 다 빠졌어. (번아웃 온 것 같아)
example:
A: You look tired.
B: I feel drained. Work is crazy.
A: You need a vacation.
B: I need a coma.
A: Sleep this weekend.
B: That's the plan.
japanese: ヘトヘトだ。／エネルギー切（ぎ）れだ。
chinese: 才怪呢 (Cái guài ne) / 怎么可能 (Zěnme kěnéng)

example:
A: I got a ticket for speeding.
B: Serves you right. You drive like a maniac.
A: Not helpful.
B: Drive slower.
A: I was late!
B: Better late than fined.
japanese: 自業自得（じごうじとく）だ。／ざまあみろ。
chinese: 迟到总比不到好 (Chídào zǒng bǐ bù dào hǎo) / 亡羊补牢 (Wángyángbǔláo)

primary: I’m up for it / I’m down
example:
A: We're going to that new jazz club in Soho tonight. 
B: I'm down, I've heard the music there is amazing. 
A: It’s supposed to be the best in the city. 
B: I'm totally up for it, what time are we meeting? 
A: Let's link up around 8 PM. 
B: Sounds like a plan, count me in!
japanese: 賛成（さんせい）。／やるやる。
chinese: 有什么了不起的 (Yǒu shénme liǎobùqǐ de) / 大惊小怪 (Dàjīngxiǎoguài)

example:
A: The concert is cancelled.
B: That's a bummer.
A: I was looking forward to it.
B: Me too.
A: Refunds?
B: Hopefully.
japanese: 残念（ざんねん）だ。／ガッカリだ。
chinese: 干杯 (Gānbēi) / 干了 (Gàn le)

example:
A: Did you tell Jenny?
B: No! She's got a big mouth.
A: Good. Keep it quiet.
B: My lips are sealed.
A: Trust no one.
B: Especially Jenny.
japanese: 口（くち）が軽（かる）い。／スピーカーだ。
chinese: 祝你成功 (Zhù nǐ chénggōng) / 加油 (Jiāyóu)

example:
A: You broke the vase!
B: I'm a bit ham-fisted today.
A: Use two hands!
B: Sorry.
A: Glue it.
B: I'll try.
japanese: 不器用（ぶきよう）だ。／手先（てさき）が鈍（にぶ）い。
chinese: 顺便说一下 (Shùnbiàn shuō yīxià) / 话说 (Huàshuō)

example:
A: How did you end up in Mexico?
B: One thing led to another.
A: Sounds wild.
B: It was a crazy night.
A: Tell me everything.
B: Maybe later.
japanese: いろいろあって。／成（な）り行（ゆ）きで。
chinese: 没办法 (Méi bànfǎ) / 忍不住 (Rěnbùzhù)

primary: What on earth are you doing?
example:
A: I'm painting the cat blue.
B: What on earth are you doing?
A: He wants to differ.
B: Stop that immediately.
A: Fine.
B: Wash him.
japanese: 一体（いったい）何（なに）してるの？／正気（しょうき）か？
chinese: 振作点 (Zhènzuò diǎn) / 高兴点 (Gāoxìng diǎn)

example:
A: What's the plan?
B: Just gonna soak up the sun.
A: Don't get burned.
B: I have SPF 50.
A: Smart.
B: Safety first.
japanese: 日光浴（にっこうよく）をする。／日差（ひざ）しを浴（あ）びる。
chinese: 拜托 (Bàituō) / 快点 (Kuài diǎn)

example:
A: Did he steal the cookies?
B: I caught him red-handed with crumbs on his face.
A: Deny it?
B: He couldn't.
A: Guilty.
B: Very.
japanese: 現行犯（げんこうはん）で捕（つか）まえた。／現場（げんば）を押（お）さえた。
chinese: 算我一个 (Suàn wǒ yīgè) / 我也参加 (Wǒ yě cānjiā)

primary: I can't resist a draft beer on a hot day like this
meaning: 이렇게 더운 날 생맥주는 못 참지.
similar: Nothing beats a cold beer today.
A beer would hit the spot.
example:
A: It's scorching outside.
B: I can't resist a draft beer on a hot day like this.
A: Let's go to the pub.
B: Way ahead of you.
A: Pitcher?
B: Two pitchers.
japanese: この暑（あつ）さじゃビールには勝（か）てない。／ビールしかないね。
chinese: 停下来 (Tíng xiàlái) / 别闹了 (Bié nào le)

example:
A: I'm having the steak.
B: Yum.
A: How about you?
B: I'll stick to salad.
A: Diet?
B: Forever.
japanese: 君（きみ）はどう？／そっちは？
chinese: 开动吧 (Kāidòng ba) / 别客气，吃吧 (Bié kèqi, chī ba)

example:
A: I brought coffee.
B: Oh, that's what I need.
A: Long night?
B: The longest.
A: Drink up.
B: You're a lifesaver.
japanese: これだよこれ。／求（もと）めてたのはこれだ。
chinese: 快告诉我 (Kuài gàosu wǒ) / 快说说 (Kuài shuōshuo)

meaning: 사춘기, 청년기 혼란, 중년의 변화, 권태기 등 인생의 큰 변화 단계
example:
A: Feels like I'm executed a huge shift.
B: Life stages, man. We all go through it.
A: Yeah, but this transition is rough.
B: Just growing pains, you'll adapt.
A: Hope this chapter ends soon.
B: The next one stays better, trust me.
japanese: 人生（じんせい）の節目（ふしめ）。／転換（てんかん）期（き）。
chinese: 别担心 (Bié dānxīn) / 没事 (Méishì)

example:
A: Look at him bringing donuts to the boss.
B: He's trying to suck up.
A: It's working.
B: Sadly.
A: We should bring pizza.
B: Genius.
japanese: ゴマすり。／太鼓持（たいこも）ち。
chinese: 慢慢来 (Mànman lái) / 小心点 (Xiǎoxīn diǎn)

example:
A: He cooks, cleans, and loves cats.
B: Sounds like good husband material.
A: He is.
B: Lock that down.
A: I'm trying.
B: Try harder.
japanese: いい夫（おっと）になるよ。／優良（ゆうりょう）物件（ぶっけん）。
chinese: 算你说的有理 (Suàn nǐ shuō de yǒulǐ) / 还行吧 (Hái xíng ba)

example:
A: Is it 'affect' or 'effect'?
B: I always mix things up.
A: Me too.
B: Let's just use 'impact'.
A: Smart.
B: Laziness wins.
japanese: ごっちゃになる。／混同（こんどう）しちゃう。
chinese: 尽管 (Jǐnguǎn) / 别拘束 (Bié jūshù)

similar: I'm acquiring a taste for it.
example:
A: Do you like this song?
B: At first no, but it's growing on me.
A: It's catchy.
B: Stuck in my head now.
A: Mission accomplished.
B: Thanks a lot.
japanese: だんだん好（す）きになってきた。／ジワジワくる。
chinese: 真的吗? (Zhēnde ma?) / 没开玩笑吧? (Méi kāiwánxiào ba?)

example:
A: Steve became a monk.
B: Who would've thought?
A: He was such a party animal.
B: People change.
A: Drastically.
B: Indeed.
japanese: まさか。／予想外（よそうがい）だ。
chinese: 走开 (Zǒukāi) / 离我远点 (Lí wǒ yuǎn diǎn)

meaning: 요리조리 잘 빠져나가는 사람. (잔꾀 많은 사람)
example:
A: Did he pay you back?
B: No, he had another excuse. He's an artful dodger.
A: Stop lending him money.
B: Lesson learned.
A: Finally.
B: Don't rub it in.
japanese: 要領（ようりょう）がいい奴（やつ）。／逃（に）げ上手（じょうず）。
chinese: 去吧 (Qù ba) / 勇敢去做 (Yǒnggǎn qù zuò)

example:
A: The movie was boring.
B: Really? I found it captivating.
A: You fell asleep.
B: I was meditating on the plot.
A: Sure.
B: It was deep.
japanese: 心（こころ）を奪（うば）われる。／魅了（みりょう）される。
chinese: 干得好 (Gàn de hǎo) / 做得不错 (Zuò de bùcuò)

example:
A: Who is she?
B: She's my BFF.
A: You dress alike.
B: Telepathy.
A: Creepy.
B: Cute.
japanese: 親友（しんゆう）。／マブダチ。
chinese: 你猜怎么着? (Nǐ cāi zěnmezháo?) / 想不到吧 (Xiǎng bù dào ba)

example:
A: I can't believe he told the boss.
B: Total stab in the back.
A: I trusted him.
B: Never trust a snitch.
A: Truth.
B: Watch your back.
japanese: 裏切（うらぎ）り。／背信（はいしん）行為（こうい）。
chinese: 等一下 (Děng yīxià) / 别挂电话 (Bié guà diànhuà)

example:
A: Can you fix the sink?
B: I'll take a stab at it.
A: Do you know plumbing?
B: Youtube does.
A: Oh boy.
B: Stand back.
japanese: やってみる。／挑戦（ちょうせん）してみる。
chinese: 玩得开心 (Wán de kāixīn) / 好好玩 (Hǎohǎo wán)

meaning: 그건 내 전문이야 / 내가 할 일이야
example:
A: Do you need help with the social media marketing? 
B: No thanks, that's my thing, not yours. 
A: I just thought I could give some input. 
B: I appreciate it, but I've got this covered. 
A: Alright, I'll stay in my lane then. 
B: Thanks, this is my area of expertise after all.
japanese: 私（わたし）の専門（せんもん）だ。／任（まか）せて。
chinese: 自便 (Zìbiàn) / 自己动手 (Zìjǐ dòngshǒu)

similar: Fell off the face of the earth.
example:
A: Where's Tom?
B: He went ghost after the bill came.
A: Typical.
B: He owes me $50.
A: Venmo request him.
B: Blocked.
japanese: 連絡（れんらく）を絶（た）った。／バックれた。
chinese: 等等 (Děngděng) / 坚持住 (Jiānchí zhù)

example:
A: Is she the best singer?
B: Without a doubt.
A: Better than Beyonce?
B: Let's not go that far.
A: Smart move.
B: Queen B rules.
japanese: 間違（まちが）いない。／疑（うたが）う余地（よち）なし。
chinese: 怎么样? (Zěnmeyàng?) / 挺好的吗? (Tǐng hǎo de ma?)

example:
A: Why is the road closed?
B: Apparently, there was a parade.
A: I didn't see any floats.
B: Maybe it was an invisible parade.
A: Ha ha.
B: Or I'm wrong.
japanese: らしいよ。／見（み）たところ。
chinese: 我等不及了 (Wǒ děngbùjí le) / 迫不及待 (Pòbùjídài)

example:
A: Do you need help moving?
B: thanks, but I can do it on my own.
A: You have a piano.
B: I have strong legs.
A: Good luck.
B: I'll need it.
japanese: 一人（ひとり）で。／自力（じりき）で。
chinese: 我深表怀疑 (Wǒ shēnbiǎo huáiyí) / 不见得吧 (Bùjiàndé ba)

example:
A: How was the meeting?
B: It was a dumpster fire.
A: Yelling?
B: And crying.
A: Yikes.
B: Need a drink.
japanese: 大惨事（だいさんじ）。／目（め）も当（あ）てられない。
chinese: 我洗耳恭听 (Wǒ xǐ'ěr gōngtīng) / 我听着呢 (Wǒ tīngzhe ne)

example:
A: Are you going to the prom?
B: Yeah, but my dad is a chaperone.
A: Nightmare.
B: Total buzzkill.
A: Hide the punch.
B: Already did.
japanese: 付（つ）き添（そ）い人（にん）。／お目付（めつ）け役（やく）。
chinese: 做梦去吧 (Zuòmèng qù ba) / 想得美 (Xiǎng de měi)

example:
A: I want to break free from this job.
B: Quit.
A: I need money.
B: Buy a lottery ticket.
A: Solid plan.
B: 50/50 chance.
japanese: 自由（じゆう）になる。／解き放（ときはな）たれる。
chinese: 看情况 (Kàn qíngkuàng) / 这得看... (Zhè děi kàn...)

example:
A: How was his apology?
B: Sounds very rehearsed.
A: Did he mean it?
B: Not a word.
A: Dump him.
B: Done.
japanese: 台本（だいほん）読（よ）んでるみたい。／棒読（ぼうよ）みだ。
chinese: 开玩笑呢 (Kāi wánxiào ne) / 逗你玩呢 (Dòu nǐ wán ne)

example:
A: He got fired.
B: Did he get severance pay?
A: A nice chunk.
B: Lucky guy.
A: Still unemployed though.
B: True.
japanese: 退職（たいしょく）金（きん）。／手切（てぎ）れ金（きん）。
chinese: 继续努力 (Jìxù nǔlì) / 保持住 (Bǎochí zhù)

example:
A: My diamond shoes are too tight.
B: Cry me a river.
A: It hurts!
B: First world problems.
A: You're mean.
B: You're ridiculous.
japanese: くだらないことで泣（な）くな。／同情（どうじょう）しないよ。
chinese: 长话短说 (Chánghuà duǎnshuō) / 简而言之 (Jiǎn'éryánzhī)

meaning: 모르는 척하지 마 / 시치미 떼지 마
similar: 2. You know exactly what I mean
example:
A: I have no idea where your chocolate went. 
B: Don't play dumb, I saw the wrapper in your trash. 
A: Maybe someone else put it there? 
B: Don't play innocent with me, you have crumbs on your shirt! 
A: Okay, okay, you caught me. 
B: Quit the act and just apologize!
japanese: わからないフリしないで。／シラを切（き）るな。
chinese: 当心 (Dāngxīn) / 小心 (Xiǎoxīn)

example:
A: Is he famous?
B: Yes, but he keeps a low profile.
A: No paparazzi?
B: He avoids them.
A: Smart celebrity.
B: Rare breed.
japanese: 目立（めだ）たない。／低姿勢（ていしせい）。
chinese: 有道理 (Yǒu dàolǐ) / 说得通 (Shuō de tōng)

example:
A: Dinner is ready!
B: I'm coming... in 10 minutes.
A: The noodles are soggy.
B: I like them that way.
A: You monster.
B: Slurp.
japanese: 麺（めん）が伸（の）びてる。／ブヨブヨだ。
chinese: 改天吧 (Gǎitiān ba) / 下次再说 (Xiàcì zàishuō)

primary: I won an award at the art contest
example:
A: Guess what?
B: You won the lottery?
A: No, I won an award at the art contest!
B: That's even better.
A: Is it?
B: No, lottery is better. But congrats!
japanese: 賞（しょう）を取（と）った。／受賞（じゅしょう）した。
chinese: 想得美 (Xiǎng de měi) / 试得不错 (Shì de bùcuò)

meaning: 눈에 넣어도 안 아픈 존재. (가장 소중한 사람)
example:
A: You spoil your daughter.
B: She's the apple of my eye.
A: She's a brat.
B: She's spirited.
A: Blind love.
B: Best kind.
japanese: 目（め）に入（い）れても痛（いた）くない。／溺愛（できあい）してる。
chinese: 没事儿 (Méi shìr) / 小事一桩 (Xiǎoshì yī zhuāng)

example:
A: Stand up.
B: I can't, my leg fell asleep.
A: Shake it off.
B: It feels like ants are biting me.
A: Dance it off.
B: Ouch.
japanese: 足（あし）が痺（しび）れた。／感覚（かんかく）がない。
chinese: 我腿麻了 (Wǒ tuǐ má le) / 腿没知觉了 (Tuǐ méi zhījué le)

example:
A: This movie is terrible.
B: I didn't pick it!
A: You suggested it.
B: I said 'maybe'.
A: Excuses.
B: Watch or leave.
japanese: 私（わたし）が選（えら）んだんじゃない。／私（わたし）のせいじゃない。
chinese: 不是我选的 (Bùshì wǒ xuǎn de) / 不是我挑的 (Bùshì wǒ tiāo de)

primary: I have a lot on my plate
example:
A: Can you help me move?
B: Sorry, I have a lot on my plate right now.
A: Just one box?
B: I have deadlines.
A: Fine.
B: Good luck.
japanese: 手（て）一杯（いっぱい）だ。／余裕（よゆう）がない。
chinese: 我事儿多着呢 (Wǒ shìr duō zhe ne) / 忙得不可开交 (Máng de bùkěkāijiāo)

similar: Let's pick it up from there.
example:
A: I'm stuck on chapter 3.
B: Okay, we'll start from there.
A: I don't understand the plot.
B: Neither does the author.
A: Really?
B: Just kidding.
japanese: そこから始（はじ）めよう。／そこんところから。
chinese: 我们从那儿开始 (Wǒmen cóng nàr kāishǐ) / 就从那儿说起吧 (Jiù cóng nàr shuō qǐ ba)

example:
A: Why is everyone staring at me?
B: Your fly is open.
A: Oh my god.
B: XYZ, buddy.
A: Did you see anything?
B: Too much.
japanese: チャック開（あ）いてるよ。／社会（しゃかい）の窓（まど）全開（ぜんかい）。
chinese: 你拉链没拉 (Nǐ lāliàn méi lā) / 裤子门儿开了 (Kùzi ménr kāi le)

meaning: 피자는 너를 비난하지 않아. (음식은 배신하지 않아)
similar: Pizza is always there for you.
example:
A: I'm lonely.
B: Order a pizza. Pizza doesn't judge.
A: It just makes me fat.
B: That's just more of you to love.
A: You're an enabler.
B: I'm a good friend.
japanese: ピザは裏切（うらぎ）らない。／ピザは正義（せいぎ）。
chinese: 比萨饼不会说三道四 (Bĭsàbĭng bù huì shuōsāndàosì) / 吃比萨最自在 (Chī bĭsà zuì zìzài)

similar: 2. Time for me to hit the road
example:
A: This coffee was great, but look at the time! 
B: Yeah, it's getting pretty late. 
A: I better be off if I want to catch the last train. 
B: No problem, I should get going too. 
A: Let's do this again next week. 
B: For sure, I've gotta run now, see ya!
japanese: もう行（い）かなくちゃ。／お暇（いとま）するね。
chinese: 我得走了 (Wǒ děi zǒu le) / 我该告辞了 (Wǒ gāi gàocí le)

example:
A: I'm bored. Bye.
B: You can't just leave! We're in the middle of a game.
A: I'm losing.
B: Be a good sport.
A: No.
B: Come back!
japanese: 帰（かえ）っちゃダメ。／抜（ぬ）けられないよ。
chinese: 你不能就这么走了 (Nǐ bùnéng jiù zhème zǒu le) / 别走啊 (Bié zǒu a)

example:
A: I'm going to quit my job and become a mime.
B: Think it through.
A: I have.
B: Mimes don't talk. You love talking.
A: Good point.
B: Stick to your day job.
japanese: よく考（かんが）えて。／熟考（じゅっこう）して。
chinese: 考虑清楚 (Kǎolǜ qīngchu) / 好好想想 (Hǎohǎo xiǎngxiǎng)

example:
A: I bought Bitcoin in 2010.
B: Nice.
A: Little did I know I'd lose the password.
B: Tragedy.
A: Billions gone.
B: Don't cry.
japanese: 夢（ゆめ）にも思（おも）わなかった。／知（し）る由（よし）もなかった。
chinese: 我哪儿知道 (Wǒ nǎr zhīdào) / 没想到 (Méi xiǎngdào)

example:
A: Let's go.
B: Wait! There's a post-credit scene.
A: Are you sure?
B: It's a Marvel movie. There's always one.
A: Five more minutes?
B: Sit down.
japanese: おまけ映像（えいぞう）。／エンドロール後（ご）。
chinese: 片尾彩蛋 (Piànwěi cǎidàn) / 花絮 (Huāxù)

example:
A: Did the package arrive?
B: Yes, it's completely intact.
A: Phew. It was glass.
B: Good packing.
A: Bubble wrap implies love.
B: Sure.
japanese: 無傷（むきず）。／そのまま。
chinese: 完好无损 (Wánhǎowú sǔn) / 完整的 (Wánzhěng de)

example:
A: I want to buy a llama.
B: That's so random.
A: They spark joy.
B: They spit.
A: Only when angry.
B: Good luck.
japanese: いきなりだね。／脈絡（みゃくらく）ないね。
chinese: 太突然了 (Tài tūrán le) / 莫名其妙 (Mòmíngqímiào)

example:
A: Look at them holding hands.
B: They're newlyweds.
A: Give it a year.
B: Cynic.
A: Realist.
B: Let them carry the torch.
japanese: 新婚（しんこん）さん。／ラブラブ。
chinese: 新婚夫妇 (Xīnhūn fūfù) / 刚结婚的小两口 (Gāng jiéhūn de xiǎoliǎngkǒu)

example:
A: He's very left-wing.
B: And she's conservative.
A: Opposites attract?
B: Or argue constantly.
A: Probably the latter.
B: Dinner must be fun.
japanese: 左派（さは）。／リベラル。
chinese: 左翼 (Zuǒyì) / 激进派 (Jījìnpài)

example:
A: Is a tomato a vegetable?
B: Technically speaking, it's a fruit.
A: Don't put it in fruit salad.
B: Knowledge is knowing it's a fruit; wisdom is not putting it in a fruit salad.
A: Deep.
B: Old quote.
japanese: 厳密（げんみつ）に言（い）えば。／定義（ていぎ）上（じょう）は。
chinese: 严格来说 (Yángé lái shuō) / 技术层面上说 (Jìshù céngmiàn shàng shuō)

example:
A: I was right, wasn't I?
B: I hate to admit it, but yes.
A: Say it louder.
B: Don't push your luck.
A: I'll record it.
B: No.
japanese: 認（みと）めたくないけど。／癪（しゃく）だけど。
chinese: 我真不想承认 (Wǒ zhēn bù xiǎng chéngrèn) / 虽说我不愿意承认 (Suīshuō wǒ bù yuànyì chéngrèn)
